content:
衛生福利部民國107年7月20日 衛部秘字第1072161286號通知單註銷密等
-
In all instances where it is pos ible to do so, recently isolated strains of the various Shigella serotypes will be selected for distribution to National Shigella Centres. Those cultures will be chosen from materials available at both the International Shigella Centres, and the selected standard or type oultures will be studied in both the Centres nad then dried (lyophilized) in large lots by the National Collection of Type Cultures, London, - for both Centres. The dried standard Shigella sorotypos will then be made available to the two Contres, for rerexamination and subsequent distribution to National Shigella Contres in various countries. Future supplies of antisera, referred to in the paragraph below, will be prepared with these standard cultures. The standard culturas my be changed from time to time if replacement of certain strains is warranted because of variational changes or development of roughness.
Each of the International Shigella Centres will prepare and sup ly unabsorbed antisera for the more common Shigella serotypes to National Shigella Centres. The antisera will be accompanied by dried cultures of the homologous Shigella serotypes, together with any additional strains that may be required for proper absorption of certain antisera. A list of the 13 individual anti- sera to be supplied to National Shi ella Centres is given in table III (sco page 13)
If any National Shigella Centre should wish to expand ite programme und activities so as to include identification of additional Shigella serotypes ;the International Shigella Centre, Atlanta, would be willing to prepare and supply the required antisera. Dried cultur s to accompany such antisera would be prepared, in the manner mentioned above, by the National Collection of Type Cu Cultures.
1 The National Collection of Type Cultures, London, may be regarded as one of the three component units of the National Shigella Centro of the United Kingdom, the other two being the Standards Laboratory for Serological Reagents and the Dysentery Reference Laboratory. The structure of this Centre is therefore analogous to that of the United Kingdom National Salmonella Centre as described on page 17.
22th Academia Historica
-8 -

Centres. The antisera will be accompanied by dried cultures of the homologous
Shigella serotypes, together with any additional strains that may be required
for proper absorption of certain antisera. A list of the 13 individual anti-

page 13)
If any National Shigella Centre should wish to expand ite programme
und activities so as to include identification of additional Shigella serotypes
;the International Shigella Centre, Atlanta, would be willing to prepare and
supply the required antisera. Dried cultur s to accompany such antisera would

Cultures.
The National Collection of Type Cultures, London, may be regarded as one of the

Laboratory. The structure of this Centre is therefore analogous to that of the
United Kingdom National Salmonella Centre as described on page 17.

Each of the International Shigella Centres will prepare and sup ly unabsorbed antisera for the more common Shigella serotypes to National Shigella Centres.
